Package ships

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
ships.Ship
public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
The Ship class is for creating Ship objects with different properties. In this game, there are four kinds of Ship objects which are different from each other by name, speed, maximum cannon number, minimum crew number, default capacity and default durability. All ship objects are initialized in WorldConstructor object.
Author:
Finn van Dorsser, Meng Zhang

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Ship​(java.lang.String name, int minCrewNum, int sailorCost, int defaultCapacity, int cannons, int defaultDurability, java.lang.String speed)
    This constructor sets the values for all the attributes except for the captain attribute, calculates the maxCannons by adding 10 to cannons, set shipSailingModifier by the string value of speed, and initializes new empty ArrayLists for attribute cargos and upgradLogs.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship​(java.lang.String name, int minCrewNum, int sailorCost, int defaultCapacity, int cannons, int defaultDurability, java.lang.String speed)
      This constructor sets the values for all the attributes except for the captain attribute, calculates the maxCannons by adding 10 to cannons, set shipSailingModifier by the string value of speed, and initializes new empty ArrayLists for attribute cargos and upgradLogs.
      Parameters:
      name - a sting describing this Ship object's name
      minCrewNum - an integer of this Ship object's minimum crew number
      sailorCost - the cost of each sailor per day on this Ship object
      defaultCapacity - the number of this Ship object's default capacity
      cannons - the number of this Ship object's cannons
      defaultDurability - the number of this Ship object's default durability
      speed - a string describing this Ship object's speed which can be set as "fast", "normal", or "slow".

    • getCargoItem

      public items.Item getCargoItem​(java.lang.String itemName)
      This method iterates the ArrayList stored in cargos attribute to check if there is an Item object with the name itemName.
      Parameters:
      itemName - a string name of an item
      Returns:
      If the item with the name itemName exists, this method returns the Item object. If not, this method returns null.

      public void addCrewNumber​(int num)
      This method adds an integer num to the crewNum attribute and updates the costPerDay attribute according to the value of the new crewNum.
      Parameters:

    • addToCargos

      public void addToCargos​(items.Item item, int quantity)
      This method adds a new Item to the cargos attribute and reduce the current capacity of the this Ship object. If the same kind of Item is already in cargos, only its quantity will be updated. Otherwise, the new Item will be added to the cargos.
      Parameters:
      item - an Item object
      quantity - the quantity number of the new Item to add to the cargoes

    • subtractFromCargos

      public void subtractFromCargos​(items.Item soldItem, int quantity)
      This method removes a specific quantity of Item out of cargos and updates the capacity attribute. If the quantity of the item to remove is higher than the soldItem quantity, only the quantity of the item to remove will be updated. Otherwise the item object itself will be removed from the cargos attribute.
      Parameters:
      soldItem - an Item object
      quantity - the value of the quantity of the soldItem

    • addCapacity

      public void addCapacity​(int amount)
      This method adds an integer amount to the remainingCapacity attribute. If the amount plus current remainingCapacity is larger than the default capacity of this Ship object, the remainingCapacity will be set to the same with the value of defaultCapacity.
      Parameters:
      amount - an integer value to add to the remainingCapacity of this Ship object

    • subtractCapacity

      public void subtractCapacity​(int amount)
      This method subtracts an integer amount from the remainingCapacity attribute. If the current remainingCapacity minus the amount equal to or less than 0, the remainingCapacity will be set 0.
      Parameters:
      amount - an integer value to subtract from the remainingCapacity of this Ship object

    • checkCapacityOK

      public boolean checkCapacityOK​(int toReduce)
      This method checks if the value of capacity attribute is less than 0 after a specific amount is reduced from it.
      Parameters:
      toReduce - an integer amount to be reduced from capacity of this Ship object.
      Returns:
      true if the value of capacity is greater or equal to 0 after a specific amount is reduced from it. Otherwise, false.

    • setDurability

      public void setDurability​(int num)
      This method is the setter of durability attribute.
      Parameters:
      num - an integer to set durability of this Ship object

    • setDefaultDurability

      public void setDefaultDurability​(int num)
      This method is the setter of defaultDurability attribute.
      Parameters:
      num - an integer to set defaultDurability of this Ship object

    • setCannons

      public void setCannons​(int num)
      This method is the setter of cannons attribute.
      Parameters:
      num - an integer to set the number of cannons of this Ship object

    • addCannons

      public void addCannons​(int num)
      This method adds a specific number of cannons to the cannons attribute. If the current cannon number plus the number to be added to it is greater than the value of maxCannons, an error message is printed out.
      Parameters:
      num - the number of cannons to be added

    • sufferDamage

      public void sufferDamage​(int damage)
      This methods subtracts a damage value from the durability attribute. If the durability is less than 0 after the subtraction, it will be set to be 0.
      Parameters:
      damage - an integer value to be subtracted from the durability of this Ship object

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(java.lang.String speed)
      This methods is the setter of speed attribute.
      Parameters:
      speed - a string ("fast", "normal", or "slow") that describes the speed of this Ship object

    • setShipSailingModifier

      public void setShipSailingModifier​(int shipSailingModifier)
      This method is the setter of shipSailingModifier attribute.
      Parameters:
      shipSailingModifier - an integer to set the value of shipSaillingModifier for this Ship object

    • emptyCargos

      public void emptyCargos()
      This method resets the cargos attribute to be an empty ArrayList.

    • addToUpgradeLogs

      public void addToUpgradeLogs​(map.Island location, java.lang.String service, int cost)
      This method adds an UpgradeLog to the upgradeLogs attribute. An UpgradeLog includes a piece of upgrade/repair log recording the location, service name and corresponding cost.
      Parameters:
      location - an Island object
      service - the string name of the upgrade service ("Damage Repair" or "Cannon Upgrade")
      cost - the integer value of the upgrade/repair cost

    • readyToSail

      public boolean readyToSail​(map.Island destination)
      This method checks if the sailing conditions to sail to another Island are met.

      To sail to another Island:

      • the remaining days of the ship's captain should be greater or equal to the days to the destination island;
      • the ship's captain should own enough money (at least the same with the cost to the destination island) to pay the crew to finish the sailing;
      • the ship should not have any damage.
      Parameters:
      destination - an Island object
      Returns:
      true if the sailing conditions are met. Otherwise, false.

    • sailTo

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sailTo​(map.Island destination)
      This method changes the location Island of this Ship object and its captain Trader object to be the destination Island if the sailing methods are met. Otherwise, the ship and its captain stay where they are.
      Parameters:
      destination - an Island object
      Returns:
      an array list of string reports on sailing. If the sailing conditions are met, the reports include all the consequences of the random events which happens on the way. If not, the reports include the messages of unsatisfied sailing conditions.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This methods modifies the string representation of this ship object.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
